subject: p13352405
History: -year-old man status post right thoracotomy, decortication, now with chest tube x 3 to water seal.
Findings: The three chest tubes remain stable in position compared to the prior study. The appearance of the right hemithorax including the clips is unchanged as compared to the previous examination however, it appears that the soft tissue collection of air has increased in size. There is increased gas filling of colon interposed between the chest wall and the liver, and continued elevation of the right hemidiaphragm. Unchanged normal appearance of the cardiac silhouette and the left lung. No current evidence of pneumothorax.
Impression: Findings remain stable compared to the previous study with the exception of increased air with the soft tissues of the right lateral chest wall.
